H0.text: Six electrons are the number of electrons in the neutral state of an atom whose nucleus has an electrical charge of +12.

H1.text: 12 electrons are present in the neutral atom with a +12 nuclear charge.

H2.text: 18 electrons are present in the neutral atom whose nucleus has an electrical charge of +12.

H3.text: 24 electrons are the number of electrons the atom has in its neutral state when its nucleus carries an electrical charge of +12.

A4.text: In an ordinary uncharged atom, the atomic number is also equal to the number of electrons.
